title: SASjs Config File
description: The SASjs Config file provides the settings for your SASjs project.

docConfig.title: The docConfig schema
docConfig.description: SASjs uses doxygen to auto-generate HTML documentation using the headers in your SAS programs, macros, services & jobs. For more info, see [https://cli.sasjs.io/doc](https://cli.sasjs.io/doc).

displayMacroCore.title: The displayMacroCore docConfig option
displayMacroCore.description: The CLI will autocompile macro dependencies that exist in the SASjs Macro Core library.  These will also show in the documentation under 'node_modules'.  If you'd prefer not to show these in the rendered docs, set this value to false.

outDirectory.title: The outDirectory docConfig option
outDirectory.description: This is the location to which the generated HTML SAS documentation will be written.  If missing, or left blank, the files will be written to the `sasjsbuild/doc` directory (default behaviour).

buildConfig.title: The buildConfig schema
buildConfig.description: The buildConfig dictates which files get compiled into the build program (.sas), which can be used to deploy services into SAS 9 or Viya environments (without a client/secret). If you are using this approach to deploy your application (SAS code driven) then you may use this config to include build specific macros, programs or macro variables - to be run a single time, on deployment - for things like database creation, or exporting a SAS 9 SPK after service creation.

initProgram.title: The buildConfig initProgram
initProgram.description: The path to a .sas program that will be inserted at the start of the build .sas program (created when running sasjs build).

termProgram.title: The buildConfig termProgram
termProgram.description: The path to a .sas program that will be inserted at the end of the build .sas program (created when running sasjs build).

macroVars.title: The buildConfig macro variables

deployConfig.title: The deployConfig schema
deployConfig.description: The deployConfig object enables settings that relate to the deployment of a SAS app - be that Viya, or SAS 9, or a pure Base environment.

deployScripts.title: The deployConfig deployScripts array
deployScripts.description: These scripts are executed when running `sasjs deploy`.  If the file is a .sas file, it is executed on the SAS server (Viya only).  Otherwise it is executed locally.  These scripts are run AFTER the deployment of the servicepack, if `deployServicePack:true` (Viya only).

serviceConfig.title: The serviceConfig schema
serviceConfig.description: The serviceConfig object defines how SASjs web services are compiled.  Web services differ from jobs in that they include some fixed pre-code (eg the macros to stream out the result json).

serviceFolders.title: The serviceConfig serviceFolders array
serviceFolders.description: When running `sasjs compile`, all programs in the folders defined in this array are compiled and placed into same-named folders under `sasjsbuild/services`.  They will be compiled as services (so, with the service pre-code).  Folders can be absolute, or relative to the `sasjs` folder.

initProgram.title: The serviceConfig initProgram
initProgram.description: The serviceConfig `initProgram` is a .sas file that is inserted at the start of every SAS service (after compiled macros and any `macroVars`, and before the service itself).

termProgram.title: The serviceConfig termProgram
termProgram.description: The serviceConfig termProgram is inserted at the end of every service as part of `sasjs compile`.

macroVars.title: The `serviceConfig` macroVars

jobConfig.title: The jobConfig schema
jobConfig.description: The jobConfig object defines how SASjs web services are compiled.  Web services differ from jobs in that they include some fixed pre-code (eg the macros to stream out the result json).

serviceFolders.title: The jobConfig serviceFolders array
serviceFolders.description: When running `sasjs compile`, all programs in the folders defined in this array are compiled and placed into same-named folders under `sasjsbuild/jobs`. Folders can be absolute, or relative to the `sasjs` folder.

initProgram.title: The jobConfig initProgram
initProgram.description: The jobConfig `initProgram` is a .sas file that is inserted at the start of every SAS Job (after compiled macros and any `macroVars`, and before the Job itself).

termProgram.title: The jobConfig termProgram
termProgram.description: The jobConfig termProgram is inserted at the end of every Job as part of `sasjs compile`.

macroVars.title: The `jobConfig` macroVars

macroFolders.title: The macroFolders array
macroFolders.description:
The folders in this array are searched when running `sasjs compile` for any dependent SAS Macros. Dependent SAS macros are inserted at the beginning of all relevant compiled Jobs and Services. SAS Macros are found in Jobs, Services, Init / Term programs, and other Macros, by the existence of a  `

SAS Macros

` entry in the doxygen header. In addition, by default, the sasjs/core (https://core.sasjs.io) macro folders are also searched (these are created under `/node_modules/@sasjs/core` after running `npm install`).

programFolders.title: The programFolders array
programFolders.description:
These folders are searched for any dependent SAS Programs as defined in the doxygen headers of relevant Services and Jobs. Unlike SAS Macros, which can be easily inserted into the precode of a Service or Job, a SAS program requires some preparation so that it can be invoked on demand. `sasjs compile` will take any dependent SAS programs, and wrap them in a `data _null_` step with put statements, to a user-defined fileref, so that the program can be subsequently `%include`'d according to the developer's preference. The doxygen syntax is as follows: ```

SAS Programs

@li mysasprogram.sas myfref ```

targets.title: The targets object
targets.description: a target is an alias for a deployment location, and includes at a minimum, the `serverUrl`, `serverType` and `appLoc`.  Any properties defined here will override same-named properties in the sasjsconfig root.
